60b9b05f-7dbf-4d2b-8a37-da951babd2e0.name: Do not allow broken windows
60b9b05f-7dbf-4d2b-8a37-da951babd2e0.description: A broken windows is any peace of code or documentation which is hanging around not included in the integration tests suite and not matching the most up-to-date standars for work deliverables. Either bring it up to the standard level or get rid of it.

4c74155a-e19c-4d4f-b1d2-8bc3874f5f1c.name: At least 2 times passed integration tests run in each environment instance
4c74155a-e19c-4d4f-b1d2-8bc3874f5f1c.description:
At least 2 times passed unit tests run in each environment instance - run the unit tests at least twice per environment by issuing the  -a run-integration-tests shell action.
Should the run behave differently start all over from dev.

ce96b091-48f4-4b22-aa64-3c0b14371753.name: The related requirement is added in the requirements document
ce96b091-48f4-4b22-aa64-3c0b14371753.description: The related requirement is added in the requirements document - there might be one or more requirements added.

472418b5-5d46-4d4b-b29e-f650220d5027.name: Deployment to the test environment
472418b5-5d46-4d4b-b29e-f650220d5027.description: Deploy to the test environment as follows:

7fa0471c-e0ac-471d-9462-7b7083a189b3.name: Front-End tests exist with maximum test coverage
7fa0471c-e0ac-471d-9462-7b7083a189b3.description: The different control flow paths are described in the Features and Functionalities document

555a37f9-911d-49a4-a9e1-9d8986de958c.description: Restart the application layer. Well just chain the both commands.
555a37f9-911d-49a4-a9e1-9d8986de958c.name: Apply run-state changes.

f53b4655-f443-4486-aad7-4479e64de759.description: That is you feel sure that the feature or functionality does what it is supposed to be doing
f53b4655-f443-4486-aad7-4479e64de759.name: do you really feel confortable before merging this branch into develop ?!

31030104-b6c3-42a2-b8e3-e57653962895.description: Each commit must be the simpliest logical unit of code, data or documentation added to the project which could be described by the commit msg
31030104-b6c3-42a2-b8e3-e57653962895.name: All the commits start with their respective issue-id's

fb19662c-2106-41dd-a3b1-b7659e5b4673.description: Check the instructions from the DevOps Guide
fb19662c-2106-41dd-a3b1-b7659e5b4673.name: The implementation code matches the naming and coding conventions described in the DevOps Guide

ee4b8303-435f-467e-8b28-fab1175805df.description: The feature or functionality current description is added in the Features and Functionalities document.
ee4b8303-435f-467e-8b28-fab1175805df.name: The feature or functionality current description is added in the Features doc

c03526e5-75e9-4485-9a3c-f1db28eb490c.name: Check that all the files in the deployment package are the same as those in the latest commit of the dev git branch.
c03526e5-75e9-4485-9a3c-f1db28eb490c.description: Deploy to the test environment as follows:

de389411-d9ad-4a45-bda5-49aac7ad5577.name: Back-End tests exist with maximum test coverage
de389411-d9ad-4a45-bda5-49aac7ad5577.description: The different control flow paths are described in the Features and Functionalities document

573dd438-189c-4ee4-adf8-4af7c3770df6.description: Things should be as simple as possible, but not simpler - if Einstein said it it makes sense - having lost so much time in endless loops of IT complexity - the older we get the more it gets more rational.
573dd438-189c-4ee4-adf8-4af7c3770df6.name: Aim for simplicity - is there anything to be refactored left ?!
